sections.name: Hateful Loggers
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Human
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the human ancestry. Humans are a diverse array of people known for their adaptability. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by humans.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

automatic_abilities.name: Exhausted
automatic_abilities.text: Though their minds are suffused with hatred and rage, the loggers have not slept for several days and are ready to drop. They take a –2 status penalty to saving throws against effects with the sleep trait.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Nonlethal
traits.text: Attacks with this weapon are nonlethal, and are used to knock creatures unconscious instead of kill them. You can use a nonlethal weapon to make a lethal attack with a –2 circumstance penalty.

ability.name: Sneak Attack
ability.text: The logger deals 1d6 extra precision damage to creatures who are off-guard

universal_monster_ability.name: Sneak Attack
universal_monster_ability.text: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

ability.name: Vitriol

traits.name: Curse
traits.text: A curse is an effect that places some long-term affliction on a creature. Curses are always magical and are typically the result of a spell or trap. Effects with this trait can be removed only by effects that specifically target curses.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

ability.success: The target's mind is clouded by feelings of rage and hate, causing it to be off-guard against the bear's next attack. It can't use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait.
ability.failure: As success, but the target is off-guard until the end of the bear's next turn. While off-guard, it is unable to use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait.
ability.critical_failure: As failure, but the target is off-guard until the bear chooses a different target for its Vitriol.
ability.text: The hateful bear vomits a stream of caustic black sludge at a single foe it can detect within 15 feet. The bear and the target each gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all attack rolls made against each other until the bear chooses a different target for its Vitriol. The target must attempt a DC 19 Will save, with the following effects. The bear cannot use Vitriol again for 1d4 rounds.
